startAutomatedOperatorDiscoveryAsync

public java.util.concurrent.Future<DiscoveryResponse> startAutomatedOperatorDiscoveryAsync(java.lang.String clientId,
                                                                                           java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                                                                           java.net.URI discoveryUrl,
                                                                                           java.net.URI redirectUrl,
                                                                                           DiscoveryOptions options,
                                                                                           java.lang.Iterable<KeyValuePair> currentCookies)
Description copied from interface: IDiscoveryService
Allows an application to conduct discovery based on the predetermined operator/network identified operator semantics. If the operator cannot be identified the function will return the 'operator selection' form of the response. The application can then determine how to proceed i.e. open the operator selection page separately or otherwise handle this.

The operator selection functionality will display a series of pages that enables the user to identify an operator, the results are passed back to the current application as parameters on the redirect URL.

Valid discovery responses can be cached and this method can return cached data.

Specified by:
startAutomatedOperatorDiscoveryAsync in interface IDiscoveryService
Parameters:
clientId - The registered application clientId (Required)
clientSecret - the registered application client secret (Required)
discoveryUrl - The URL of the discovery endpoint (Required)
redirectUrl - The URL of the operator selection functionality redirects to. (Required)
options - Optional parameters
currentCookies - List of the current cookies sent by the browser if applicable
Returns:
the discovery response.

startAutomatedOperatorDiscoveryAsync

public java.util.concurrent.Future<DiscoveryResponse> startAutomatedOperatorDiscoveryAsync(IPreferences preferences,
                                                                                           java.net.URI redirectUrl,
                                                                                           DiscoveryOptions options,
                                                                                           java.lang.Iterable<KeyValuePair> currentCookies)
Description copied from interface: IDiscoveryService

getOperatorSelectionURLAsync

public java.util.concurrent.Future<DiscoveryResponse> getOperatorSelectionURLAsync(java.lang.String clientId,
                                                                                   java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                                                                   java.net.URI discoveryUrl,
                                                                                   java.net.URI redirectUrl)
Description copied from interface: IDiscoveryService
Allows an application to get the URL for the operator selection UI of the discovery service. This will not reference the discovery result cache. The returned URL will contain a session id created by the discovery server. The URL must be used as-is.

Specified by:
getOperatorSelectionURLAsync in interface IDiscoveryService
Parameters:
clientId - The registered application client id. (Required)
clientSecret - The registered application client secret. (Required)
discoveryUrl - The URL of the discovery end point. (Required)
redirectUrl - The URL the operator selection functionality redirects to. (Required)
Returns:
the discovery response.

parseDiscoveryRedirect

public ParsedDiscoveryRedirect parseDiscoveryRedirect(java.net.URI redirectedUrl)
Description copied from interface: IDiscoveryService
Allows an application to obtain parameters which have been passed within a discovery redirect URL

The function will parse the redirect URL and parse out the components expected for discovery i.e.

  • selectedMCC
  • selectedMNC
  • encryptedMSISDN

Specified by:
parseDiscoveryRedirect in interface IDiscoveryService
Parameters:
redirectedUrl - The URL the operator selection functionality redirected to (Required)
Returns:
the parsed discovery redirect.

completeSelectedOperatorDiscovery

public DiscoveryResponse completeSelectedOperatorDiscovery(java.lang.String clientId,
                                                           java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                                           java.net.URI discoveryUrl,
                                                           java.net.URI redirectUrl,
                                                           java.lang.String selectedMCC,
                                                           java.lang.String selectedMNC)
                                                    throws RequestFailedException,
                                                           InvalidResponseException
Description copied from interface: IDiscoveryService
Allows an application to use the selected operator MCC and MNC to obtain the discovery response. In the case there is already a discovery result in the cache and the Selected-MCC/Selected-MNC in the new request are the same as relates to the discovery result for the cached result, the cached result will be returned.

If the operator cannot be identified by the discovery service the function will return the 'operator selection' form of the response.

Specified by:
completeSelectedOperatorDiscovery in interface IDiscoveryService
Parameters:
clientId - The registered application clientId (Required)
clientSecret - the registered application client secret (Required)
discoveryUrl - The URL of the discovery endpoint (Required)
redirectUrl - The registered application redirect url (Required)
selectedMCC - The Mobile Country Code of the selected operator. (Required)
selectedMNC - The Mobile Network Code of the selected operator. (Required)
Returns:
the discovery response.
Throws:
RequestFailedException - if a failure occurred making the HTTP request.
InvalidResponseException - if a failure occurred processing the HTTP response.

In the case there is already a discovery result in the cache and the Selected-MCC/Selected-MNC in the new request are the same as relates to the discovery result for the cached result, the cached result will be returned.

If the operator cannot be identified by the discovery service the function will return the 'operator selection' form of the response.

                                                    java.lang.String mnc)
                                             throws CacheAccessException
Description copied from interface: IDiscoveryService
Helper function which retrieves a discovery response (if available) from the discovery cache which corresponds with the operator details

Specified by:
getCachedDiscoveryResponse in interface IDiscoveryService
Parameters:
mcc - The Mobile Country Code (Required)
mnc - The Mobile Network Code (Required)
Returns:
A cached entry if found, otherwise null
Throws:
CacheAccessException - if an error was encountered fetching the cache entry.

clearCache

public void clearCache()
                throws CacheAccessException
Description copied from interface: IDiscoveryService
Helper function which clears the cache. Note that this will clear everything from the cache, not just DiscoveryResponses.

Specified by:
clearCache in interface IDiscoveryService
Throws:
CacheAccessException - if there was an error clearing the cache.

clearCache

public void clearCache(java.lang.String mcc,
                       java.lang.String mnc)
                throws CacheAccessException
Description copied from interface: IDiscoveryService
Helper function which clears any result from the discovery cache which corresponds with the provided parameters.

If either mcc or mnc are null or empty the cache will be cleared.

Specified by:
clearCache in interface IDiscoveryService
Parameters:
mcc - The mobile country code of the cached object (Required)
mnc - The mobile network code of the cached object (Required)
Throws:
CacheAccessException - if there was an error clearing the cache.

getProviderMetadata

public java.util.concurrent.Future<ProviderMetadata> getProviderMetadata(DiscoveryResponse response,
                                                                         boolean forceCacheBypass)
Description copied from interface: IDiscoveryService
Retrieves an updated version of the ProviderMetadata if available, the discovery response property ProviderMetadata will also be updated with this version for future access.

This method can trigger an HTTP GET request

Specified by:
getProviderMetadata in interface IDiscoveryService
Parameters:
response - Discovery response to retrieve provider metadata for
forceCacheBypass - True if cache should be bypassed and the latest version of the ProviderMetadata should be fetched from the provider metadata endpoint. False if the cache should be tested first for a non-setExpired ProviderMetadata before trying the provider metadata endpoint.
Returns:
An updated ProviderMetadata object
